question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 1 Which one is the causative agent for Tinea versicolor?
explanation: Malassezia species are lipophilic yeasts that cause Tinea versicolor, characterized by hypopigmented or hyperpigmented macules.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 2 Which group of following fungi are included the most common causative agents for otomycosis?
explanation: Saprophytic fungi, including Aspergillus and other molds, are the most common causative agents of otomycosis.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 3 In which superficial mycosis some recurrent hypopigmented or hyperpigmented macules on sebum-rich areas of body are seen?
explanation: Tinea versicolor presents as hypopigmented or hyperpigmented macules on oily areas such as the chest and back.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 4 Which one of the following fungi are dematiaceous?
explanation: Dematiaceous fungi like Alternaria contain melanin in their cell walls, giving them a dark appearance.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 5 Which one of the following fungi is the main producer of aflatoxin?
explanation: Aspergillus flavus is a common producer of aflatoxin, a potent mycotoxin.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 6 Which one of the following mycosis is caused by dimorphic fungi?
explanation: Sporotrichosis is caused by Sporothrix schenckii, a dimorphic fungus that exists as mold in the environment and yeast in tissues.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 7 Which class of fungi has coenocytic hyphae?
explanation: Zygomycota have coenocytic (aseptate) hyphae, meaning their hyphae lack septa.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 8 Which one of the following fungi is the most common causative agent for keratomycosis?
explanation: Fusarium solani is the most common cause of fungal keratitis, especially in individuals with ocular trauma.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 9 Which one of the following fungal diseases is contagious?
explanation: Dermatophytosis (tinea) is a contagious fungal infection transmitted through direct contact with infected individuals or contaminated surfaces.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 10 Which pairs of the following diseases are caused by bacteria?
explanation: Erythrasma and trichomycosis are bacterial infections, while piedra and tinea are fungal infections.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 11 Rose syndrome is described which of the following fungal infections?
explanation: Rose gardener's syndrome is a classical presentation of sporotrichosis, characterized by nodular lesions along lymphatic channels.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 12 In which superficial mycosis are seen the macular lesions consist of one or several, flat, dark brown to black, non-scaling patches often on the palm?
explanation: Tinea nigra is characterized by flat, dark brown to black, non-scaling patches, typically on the palms or soles.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 13 The causal agents of which of the following fungal infection is thermally dimorphic fungi?
explanation: Sporothrix schenckii is a thermally dimorphic fungus, existing as mold in the environment and yeast in human tissue.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 14 In which mycotic infection CSF is a good specimen material for laboratory diagnosis?
explanation: Cryptococcus neoformans often causes cryptococcal meningitis, requiring CSF examination for diagnosis.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 15 All of the below mentioned fungal infections are exogenously acquired (has environmental source) except………. which is usually acquired from endogenous source?
explanation: Candidiasis is often caused by endogenous flora, unlike the other mycoses that are acquired from the environment.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 16 Indian ink is a useful test for diagnosis of:
explanation: Indian ink preparation is used to visualize Cryptococcus neoformans in CSF by highlighting its capsule.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 17 Onychomycosis refer to mycotic infection of:
explanation: Onychomycosis is a fungal infection of the nail, often caused by dermatophytes.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 18 In microscopic direct examination, observation of branching septated mycelia confirm the ….
explanation: Aspergillus species form branching septate hyphae, which are diagnostic under microscopy.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 19 Which form of mucormycosis is acute and dangerous?
explanation: Rhinocerebral (naso orbital) mucormycosis is an aggressive and potentially fatal form of infection.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 20 Which of the following sentences is not correct about dermatophytes?
options: Trichophyton infects hair, skin, and nails.
explanation: Epidermophyton floccosum does not infect hair; it mainly affects skin and nails.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 21 Which antifungal drug is suitable for the treatment of Tinea corporis?
explanation: Terbinafine is commonly used to treat Tinea corporis (ringworm) due to its fungicidal action against dermatophytes.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 22 Which infection usually can involve oral cavity?
explanation: Oral candidiasis (thrush) is a common fungal infection involving the oral cavity.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 23 Which one of the followings is not included in the clinical manifestation of Candidiasis:
explanation: Tinea refers to dermatophyte infections, not candidiasis.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 24 Which of the following sentences is not correct about dermatophytosis?
options: Kerion is usually associated with infection by anthropophilic dermatophyte
Direct microscopy exam of skin cannot identify the species of dermatophyte
Tinea capitis is common in children
answerText: Direct microscopy exam of skin cannot identify the species of dermatophyte
explanation: Kerion is usually caused by zoophilic dermatophytes, not anthropophilic species.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 25 Which of the following is mostly seen in children before puberty?
explanation: Tinea capitis is a scalp infection predominantly affecting children before puberty.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 26 Which one of the followings refers to dermatophytosis of the proximal medial thighs and buttocks?
explanation: Tinea cruris, also called jock itch, affects the groin and inner thighs.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 27 In which group of fungi, sexual reproduction has been not seen?
explanation: Deuteromycetes (Fungi Imperfecti) are characterized by the absence of a known sexual reproductive stage.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 28 In which form of sporotrichosis the infection may spread to eye?
explanation: Extra cutaneous sporotrichosis can involve organs beyond the skin, including the eye.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 29 ………….. and …………… are both more associated with AIDS.
explanation: Cryptococcosis and Candidiasis are common opportunistic fungal infections in AIDS patients.

question: First Batch (2024-07-07) - Dr. Hashemi & Dr. Daie - Question 30 In which mycotic infection the causative agent is a capsular yeast?
explanation: Cryptococcus neoformans is a yeast with a prominent polysaccharide capsule, aiding in its identification.
